871eda6c-cc46-4a3f-a89e-4d4cc76090c1.description: The non-credit Certified Nurse Aide is a state-approved 130-hour course combining lecture, lab, and clinical experience to prepare entry-level students to learn basic nursing care for the elderly, the ill, and the disabled in long-term care sub-acute and home health settings. Students completing the training successfully will be eligible to sit for the certification exam to become certified nurse aides (CNAs).
871eda6c-cc46-4a3f-a89e-4d4cc76090c1.name: Certified Nurse Aide Training (Kaua'i)

issuer.summary: issued by University of Hawaii Community Colleges (UHCC)

badge_template_activities.title: Describe effective nurse aide care to support and maintain patient function and health. Describe the roles and responsibilities and therapeutic communication skills with clients, families, and other members of the healthcare team. Describe nurse aide interventions to meet the emotional and physical requirements of special populations. Discuss ethical, legal principles, and professional conduct in healthcare settings. Identify healthcare infection control and safety procedures.
Proof of 9th-grade English level. Acceptable documents include college transcripts, placement test scores, prior college diplomas or certificates of training, etc.

Health clearances (with TB clearance and MMR vaccine)Criminal background check. (will be required later in the program and sent directly to the clinical site)Malpractice insurance (more details to come)

d800c5c6-3c95-4c30-914a-f02bb89ae883.description: This course is designed to educate and train nursing assistants to support licensed nursing staff in long-term care facilities. Participants will specialize in skills to include sterile gloving, wound care, oral suctioning, diabetes care, enteral nutrition, catheterization, colostomy care, specimen collection, and tracheotomy care through lecture, laboratory practice, and evaluation.
d800c5c6-3c95-4c30-914a-f02bb89ae883.name: Certified Nurse Aide Training (Leeward)

issuer.summary: issued by University of Hawaii Community Colleges (UHCC)

badge_template_activities.title: This course provides advanced nurse aide skills for acute care settings. It prepares the student to work in both hospital and long-term care facilities.

Proof of a 9th-grade English level or higher. Please submit the following as proof of this requirement: AA Degree, BA Degree, college transcripts, TABE results. OR take our EdReady assessment. Please fill out this EdReady Request Form.
Current Criminal Abstract (https://ecrim.ehawaii.gov) (abstract needs to be submitted within 30 days of issuance).
Completed Leeward CC Physical Examination Clearance Form.
On-line registration, general registration, payment call 455-0477 or email: ocewd@hawaii.edu. Financial assistance, program advising, or attending an information session.
For possible tuition assistance, please visit www.ocewd.org/hcp to learn more about the Hana Career Pathways grant program.

1482c4f9-ec5a-4e13-9c36-2cf488fa405c.description: Earn a Certificate of Professional Development as an HVAC Technician introducing fundamentals of heating, refrigeration, air conditioning and controls. Includes hybrid learning in online modules and hands-on lab training, career prep workshops, and EPA 608 exam prep and online certification exam.
1482c4f9-ec5a-4e13-9c36-2cf488fa405c.name: HVAC, Refrigerants and Basic Controls: EPA Exam Prep

issuer.summary: issued by University of Hawaii Community Colleges (UHCC)

badge_template_activities.title: Introduces the fundamentals of heating, refrigeration, air conditioning, and basic controls. The course consists of a math for trades review, online coursework in heating, refrigeration, air conditioning and basic controls, and EPA Section 608 exam preparation and practice tests.
At the end of this course, the student will be able to complete the EPA 608 Certification Exam and earn at least a Type 1 - Universal certification.
